timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		urlWhitelistPattern = Pattern.compile("https?://([a-zA-Z-.:@]+\\.)?"
          
          
            
            				+ trustedDomains.toString().replaceAll("\\.", "\\\\.")
          
          
            
            				+ "(:[0-9]{1,5})?(/[a-zA-Z0-9-()@:%_\\\\+~#.?&/=]*)?");
          
          
            
            		urlWhitelistPattern = Pattern.compile("https?://([a-zA-Z0-9-]+\\.)*"
          
          
            
            				+ trustedDomains.toString().replaceAll("\\.", "\\\\.")
          
          
            
            				+ "(:[0-9]{1,5})?(/.*)?");
          
      
    
    
  

After finding some examples that did not work because numbers incorrectly were not allowed at the front (e.g, connect4.ist.tugraz.at) and understanding that https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt has been superceded by the newer https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986 (also see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication ) meaning that passwords have been depreciated in https? requests, and that basically any character can follow in the path/query/fragment part of the URI after the host and option port number.
